rekit.logic.level

Class LevelAssembler

  • java.lang.Object
    • rekit.logic.level.LevelAssembler

  • public final class LevelAssembler
extends Object

    Manages assembling a level piece by piece for not having to build a level whole at once. The method generate(int max) must be called at least every time max changes to give the LevelAssembler the change to check if it must generate more GameElements.

    Internally, it uses a StructureManager to get the the next pieces (= Structure) to be build.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Angelo Aracri

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelAssembler(StructureManager manager)
      Constructor that initializes attributes and instructs a new StructureManager to load a level file specified by the levelName.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Orders the StructureManager to build Structures if it must.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelAssembler

        public LevelAssembler(StructureManager manager)
        Constructor that initializes attributes and instructs a new StructureManager to load a level file specified by the levelName. The seed is used for pseudo-randomizing.
        Parameters:
        manager - the structure of the level to be assembled.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Initializes all attributes. Must also be called upon re-initialization (dying, loading new level, ...).

      • generate

        public void generate(int max)
        Orders the StructureManager to build Structures if it must. This decision depends on the Structures build so far and the parameter max that specifies which x position is the smallest that needs to be generated at.
        Parameters:
        max - the lowest x position that must still be generated at.
